item.title: Arjuna after Krishna's departure
item.description: The story of Lord Krishna’s departure is well known. Lord Krishna was resting in part of a jungle, lying down, with his one leg on top of another. A hunter mistook his foot or toe to be a bird. From a distance the hunter shot a poisoned arrow aimed at the foot. On coming closer, he realized he had shot Lord Krishna. He had deep remorse. However Krishna assured him that it was an accident and that He forgives him. Lord Krisna soon left His mortal body. However what happened afterwards is less known. The Puranic stories goes about into various aspects. Following is supposedly mentioned by Baba (Shrii Shrri Anandamrtii). However we are missing cross verification.
